Reviews.Title: “Generous Hosts on beautiful land”
Reviews.Author: Nobie P
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the ranch was so friendly, casual, and welcoming I felt like I was visiting with family. I could feel the history of ranch in the home, by the fire, in the kitchen and walking on the land. The food was amazing and I brought home several recipes to share with friends and family. The location is perfect for visits to wineries. I recommend the local grocery store in Calistoga for some cheese and wine, return the ranch and sit back in a rocker and enjoy the sound of fox and other creatures of the night. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value for a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: DPrinzing
Reviews.Content: Rustic accommodations, fantastic food, and gracious hosts in a setting with mountain streams, redwood groves, soaring birds, and Napa Valley vistas. Incredible value that keeps us coming back year after year.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic experience!”
Reviews.Author: Edavt04
Reviews.Content: We wanted to get away from San Diego, and this was the perfect spot! Simple, comfortable, roomy cottages that seemed really private. Great setting! 10 min of drive from Calistoga that puts you in a relaxed mood while you are driving towards the ranch... Warm and friendly owners. Great, hearty breakfasts. I even got to feed carrots to their animals! Fun, fun, fun!!! We loved staying at the ranch! A fun gateway!!! Highly recommended if you want privacy, tranquility, authentic experience... Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “All thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: usuallyhappytravels
Reviews.Content: We were delighted! This is a lovely retreat, we felt as if the whole grand lodge was ours. There are 11 high quality teas 24h available in the breakfast room, with hot water dispenser. Decorated with seasonal theme, the huge fire place draws your attention, an inviting place to read a book. Breakfast was fabulous: fruit plate with pine apple, orange, banana, blueberries, raspberries, grapes, cantilope, strawberries, guavas, pear. Homemade persimmon bread, home made preserves (plum, guava). Delicious omelette/scrambled eggs, pancakes, hashbrowns with squash. Toast & cereals are also there. This is not a 5 hotel star resort by any means, but a genuine authentic place to spend time relaxing, hiking and comtemplating. You'll see the milky way on a cloud-free night and it is extremely quiet out here - except for the rooster in the morning. John and Suzanne are great hosts. This place is highly recommended and much preferred over cookie cutter chains.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet and tranquil place!”
Reviews.Author: CKAP101
Reviews.Content: Cozy, warm and very down to earth. Great hiking and amazing views. Fantastic breakfasts. Delighted that things have remained as charming as ever. Definitely will make another return visit. CP

Reviews.Title: “More than just a b&b”
Reviews.Author: Mlibera
Reviews.Content: John and his wife are wonderful people that care about their guest experience. We had a great stay there is lots to explore on the property it is secluded in the valley but close enough to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Please Don't Change It!!”
Reviews.Author: Jim B
Reviews.Content: We have come to the Mountain Home Ranch with our family for years, and love it just the way it is. My wife and I stayed in one of the rustic cabins this past weekend to celebrate our anniversary, and it was perfect. We come there to be in the country, and for $69 we can have a great getaway, with a delicious breakfast, super friendly hosts, and generally nice folks staying there who kind of like the down home funkiness and comfortableness of the place. And the owners' dedication to preservation of nature and living on the land harmoniously. Mabye it's a matter of knowing what you're coming for. It's a great place for families, and we sure do love it! Thanks John and Suzanne - see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why anyone would stay here”
Reviews.Author: R R
Reviews.Content: Notice all the good reviews only mention the views and not the rooms. There's a reason for this, they are awful. I have better towels and sheets in my rag box. I would not recommend this place at all. The cabins are dark, small and dingy. The main hotel is a little brighter but in dire need of updates. When we went to check in no one was there. Finally a young guy came by and offered us tea and cereal until he could locate the owners. I might mention that it was 3pm in the afternoon and not breakfast time. We did go to the dining room where there were stacks of dirty dishes that looked like they had been there for some time. When he still could not find anyone we asked if he would show us to our cabin. The blankets and bedspread were on the floor. He apologized that the room wasn't ready and would send for someone to put sheets on the bed right away. I just know that the same blanket and bedspread that was on the floor was going to end up back on the bed. When we decided that this cabin was not acceptable we were shown others. One had a live bird flying around in it. None were much better than the first. We decided to stay in the main part of the hotel. There was a rooster that started crowing way before sunrise and it went on and on. It was kind of like a bad snooze alarm. We were asked if we had any dietary restrictions for breakfast the night prior yet when we got up that morning there were no signs of anyone in the kitchen and those same stacks of dirty dishes were still there. We had to call and leave a voicemail for someone to come so we could check out since we never even really had checked in. Finally the owner came and took our credit card. He never mentioned breakfast (even though it is a B&B) so we just left and couldn't get out of there fast enough.

Reviews.Title: “perfect weekend! we'll be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: mamasfuntrips
Reviews.Content: For the second year in a row a large group of friends from the SF bay area spent a 4 day weekend at Mountain Home Ranch and they are making it an annual tradition. I was able to make it this year and I had a great time! We were a big group, all with young children. Our days started with a delicous breakfast of ingredients picked each morning from the garden, local and organic. We spent most of our time at the pool, which is not too fancy, but perfect for playing and lounging around. There are several short hikes that were perfect for young ones. Without leaving the ranch except for a quick trip to Calistoga for groceries and a visit to a pinoneer cemetery, we had a fabulous time. We had communal dinners under the wisteria arbor and campfires at night. I would highly recommend Mountain Home Ranch for couples who want a romantic getaway, or families and large groups. Thank You!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: MVMarinTraveler
Reviews.Content: Mtn. Home Ranch is very well described on its website so be sure you review their site fully if deciding to stay there. It's not for everyone but for those who are fine with something more rustic, it's just great. It's particular nice for families with young kids because the "rooms" (i.e. the little cabins) have small kitchens and eating areas, animals to visit and feed, lots of grounds to roam around, and 2 pools (1 heated). Your stay comes w/ breakfast, which is typically a hot carb of some type (waffle, pancake), an egg dish, a gluten-free hot dish, homemade muffins, oatmeal, cold cereal, plain yogurt, organic bread (for toast), jams, nut butter, coffee, juice. We did not take advantage of their dinner because of the price: $22 for adult and $16 for kids. There's no way our 4 year old would eat $16 worth of food (and the inn-keepers seem pretty firm about the price). One major caution: there were 2 roosters living there while we were there and they woke by sunrise every morning (in fact 1 seemed to crow virtually all night). Although otherwise peaceful setting, if you (or your kids) are a light sleeper this will drive you nuts.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in the Napa Valley?”
Reviews.Author: CaptnCanuck
Reviews.Content: Arriving in the Calistoga area without having booked a place (long road trip so very loose schedule) was daunting when calling places and hearing rates, etc. We were resigned to driving to a motel in Santa Rosa. We tried to call MHR but it was after 8pm and no answer, so lo and behold we drove right PAST the Mountain Home Ranch road and stopped in at 9:20 pm to ask if they had any space, on a hunch. John met us at the desk after I called from the office available phone and we lucked out. REALLY LUCKED OUT. It was Monday night and we were told we could stay till Friday if we needed to, which was perfect! Home base in the Napa Valley for... Very inexpensive! At time of writing, the rustic cabin we had was $69 per night for the two of us, in a cabin with three beds. And a toilet and sink. Other than that, there are other washrooms around, and summer-camp-style showers as well as swimming pool, fire place, tennis court, lawn area for games, sulphur pools, and the LOOKOUT which I discovered last night. I spent two evenings out there, quite late, and looking out over the ridge valley was incredible with no other sounds other than the odd night bird or passing plane (very very verrrrry few and far between) Nothing but a couple crickets and not even much of anything for breeze. Other nice touches are THE HOSTS John and Suzanne and the breakfast included in the price, the animals, and the sheer RELAXATION of it all. I have no problem with the rustic cabin accommodations. Be advised before you arrive, it isn't for everyone, isn't for anyone who only ever stays in "fancy hotels". They are "cabins in the woods", they just happen to have electricity, WI-FI (! Ranch/cabins with wifi????) which--be advised--tends to fade out/disconnect a fair bit, and no air conditioning. The main lodge area is very throwback-style and authentic! Can't say enough about our stay! Again... Not for everyone but... Napa lodgings for $70 including breakfast? Are you kidding me? HIGHLY RECOMMENDED--again, for those ok with rustic cabin / ranch accommodations! WILL go back again next time I'm in the valley.

Reviews.Title: “We return again and again!”
Reviews.Author: abbyklein
Reviews.Content: Our family happened upon Mountain Home Ranch several years ago. We were taken in by it's rustic simplicity, beautiful natural surroundings, friendliness of the owners, and delicious full breakfast.. It's a place where our child can go swimming to her heart's content, feed the animals, and wander relatively freely. As an only child, she always finds other kids to strike up a conversation with or play a board game (provided by the lodge) in the evenings. We alway return home feeling relaxed and restored. We now bring our friends with us and they too return again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious, relaxing and lovely”
Reviews.Author: chermanka
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night during the week; surprisingly, we had the place almost to ourselves, so experiencing that level of peace and quiet was wonderful. But, it was easy to imagine a different and equally enjoyable atmosphere of families, kids, dogs, all just enjoying themselves on this lovely property. Lots of space for walking and hiking, and plenty to do if you're willing to mostly unplug. We stayed in a cabin w/full bathroom, two bedrooms, and both a front and back porch -- clean and comfortable (small fridge too, which was handy). Overall, MHR feels like a place that has been loved by many for a long, long time. The ranch owners were warm and courteous to us first-timers; breakfast is delicious! We hope to be able to return often.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, lovely, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: wickedsorceress
Reviews.Content: MHR is in a lovely setting in the woods, rustic cabins in a small valley, undr a beautiful canopy of trees. It is rustic, so if you are a 5 start type of person, this may not be the type of place for you. But for those of us that really appreciate the outdoors this is a step up. the cabins are darling, rustic, basic, not the newest, but clean, comfotable and frankly, just what we needed away from the bustle of our daily suburb lives. The owners and staff, so friendly, accomodating and just an absolutely lovely group. They love to share their knowledge of their property and the surroundings, it truly comes from their heart, the love of their home ansd the little details of the gegraphy, folaige and history of the property. If one really wants to take some time out and listen, there is much this property and owners have to share, if one is there to relax and listen. The food was basic but good and wholesome, just what we needed after a couple days of hiking and running amuck...perfect! It is as if this is their home and all doors are open for us to read and relax in the dining/living area, tons of interesting books and just a homy comfortable enviromnment. The pool is not new, but it is clean and so refreshing! The livestock, just so darling and kept in such good order, they kept a basket of carrots out in the dining room for us to feed the cows, goats and horses with, so fun! They shared their knowledge and love of thier livestock with us. Two doggies followed us everywhere, and we can even take our doggies! Again, if you are not into rustic, this is not the place for you, but if you love silence, a step up from camping and the knowledge of those that are endured to their beautiful home and land, this is the place for you! We can't wait to go back, this is a little treasure off the beaten path! Thank you MHR, we love you!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to have a painting retreat”
Reviews.Author: Kattywomp
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful week. The painting studio and environment was ideal for painting. The rooms were very comfortable. The meals were very healthy and well prepared. The property was expansive and good for hikiing. I felt great to be taken care of so well.

Reviews.Title: “If you are a city girl, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: TravelGrrlNY
Reviews.Content: Let's just say that this was not what we were expecting. This is a cabin - and a cabin only. There were no locks on the doors and portable heaters were the only source of heat. Granted it was raining and cold when we got there so you may have a different experience if you go in the summer. The showers were separate from the cabin, but we opted not to use them. There was no hot water from the sink, but not sure about the showers since we did not try them. This place is VERY rustic so know that before you stay there. It's also up a windy hill and the nearest alternative for food is about 30 minutes away. Personally, I didn't think that $22 for dinner was worth it, but we were too tired to drive elsewhere and back in the cold rain.

Reviews.Title: “Escape from the city and meet nice people in a magical, relaxing environment”
Reviews.Author: JeffBlank
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a great experience. The location is wild and relaxing, the sound of nature will put you to sleep, and hopefully the roosters won't wake you up too early. The owners are very nice and can provide useful tips to nearby hiking trails as well as winery trips. Random notes: - Pool was not open - Everything else was, including the meditation chapel - Cabins have no lock, but they are very safe anyway because it seems that this place is only drawing nice people. - Walking distance to sulphur baths. - Great view from the Lookout point. - Wireless available

Reviews.Title: “Delightful visit - forest walks, salamanders, local conservation/firefighting, delicious preserves”
Reviews.Author: strawbelle
Reviews.Content: This place is special. The current proprieters are John and Susan. John's grandfather build the lodge, and the depth of connection to the land and local community is clearly very strong. Here are a few things that really impressed me about the stay: - I came with a friend who left with the car early in the morning. John was kind enough to offer a ride into town. This meant a bit of meandering as I followed the morning chores of an active ranch until John was ready for a run into town to buy eggs. I got to: - In the meantime, I joined Susan as she rescued endangered salamanders. The salamander population apparently has been declining, and they discovered a small nest as they were uncovering the pool for the spring. I joined Susan to release them into the local creek, which involved a bit of a hike through their mountain forest as she narrated the ecological history of the area. On the way, we saw wild orchids and she mentioned a 34ft old-growth redwood just down the way. At one point, John's grandfather served french toast in the woods to get guests to explore the really excellent hiking on the property. You can still walk the french toast trail today. - As we were driving to town, I heard John talk about how they respond as the town's firefighters (they are!) to news of a blaze--pools provide good water sources, by the way--then coordinate with air-borne planes to contain fires which can spread rapidly in dry seasons. - We stayed in a rustic cabin which was perfectly clean and sweet. $70 for a night can sleep 5 people (4 beds, one of which was a queen). Excellent deal. - Around dusk, we walked ot a lookout over the valley, and you could hear no human-generated noise at all. Just wind rustling and birds. Pretty incredible. - The home-made preserves at breakfast were really excellent: the sour plum sauce poured over freshly made waffles and spiced apple butter over oatmeal were particularly notable. Would absolutely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to return”
Reviews.Author: kellis155
Reviews.Content: I decided to book a spur of the moment overnight trip for my boyfriend last week. After finally settling on Calistoga as a destination, I quickly went to Trip Advisor to figure out where to stay. And I wasn't disapointed! Mountain Home Ranch is ranked #2 in Calistoga and rightfully so! The Ranch is just beautiful, serene and peaceful. We only stayed one night, but cannot wait to go back for a longer stay once the weather improves. John is delightful as a host as well and really goes the extra mile with customer service. He let us check in a bit early as the room was empty when we arrived. Also, we showed up after the breakfast hours, and since we were the only guests, he still cooked us up some eggs. We stayed in a rustic cabin (no showers or hot water) and it was great. Hot water would have been nice, but for the price, you're still getting quite a bargain. The rustic cabin (we stayed in "Light") was quaint and charming and certainly met all of our needs. I liked this place so much, I'm already trying to think of who I can encourage to visit and when I can come back! Please do yourself a favor and stay here. :)

Reviews.Title: “I felt welcomed, enjoyed the natural beauty and peacefulness, and loved the food!”
Reviews.Author: Jim3281
Reviews.Content: I spent most of a week here on a retreat and was happy with the entire experience. The cabins are not rustic, even though the setting is comfortably older. So for me it was very comfortable. I enjoyed the food too. I had some specific food choices which were easily accommodated. I enjoyed the walks and vistas. The meeting rooms created a congenial atmosphere for our retreat. I definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was inviting, warm, healhty, comfortable and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Nini1421
Reviews.Content: The food was delecious ,nutrious, and such care was taken to esnure the food we ate respected where it came form. I loved the cozy warm feel of the place and how kind and caring the staff were. I loved my lttle cabin with its fire place. And last but not least the settingwas beautiful and Calistoga is a charming towm

Reviews.Title: “The care and beauty I experience at Mountain Home makes the hard work I do there possible”
Reviews.Author: surfdancer2
Reviews.Content: In January of 2008 I had my first visit to Mountain Home ranch for the first week of a yearlong program that included 4 residential retreat. We work hard at these retreats: from 8 in the morning to 9 or later at night. It is due to the beauty of nature there: being able to have walks through the woods, sit amongst the trees, saunter by the creek, that I get as much out of these retreats as I do. I am grateful for the comfortable accommodations as well as the care John and Suzanne extend to their guests, and all this surrounded by their carefully nurtured land.

Reviews.Title: “Crystal clear air, gorgeous views, down home hospitality, great food”
Reviews.Author: Susana_Raine
Reviews.Content: I love rustic settings that feel completely removed from my busy, cluttered life. Mountain Home Ranch isn't far away in distance, but I felt transported to another era. Beautiful scenery, homey feeling, entertaining and openhearted owners, silence, sparkling air, beautiful and well cared for animals. My room in the main house was spacious and cosy, the bathroom simple and clean. The food was bounteous and delicious, and had the variety necessary to meet the needs of people with different preferences. Much of it locally grown. Try the plum sauce for sure, made from wild plums from the farm. I loved the views, the walk to the Grandmother Tree, the big fireplace, and the relaxed atmosphere. I definitely recommend it for nurturing your body and soul!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort of home but with delicious food cooked by the hosts”
Reviews.Author: Nalayini11
Reviews.Content: There are so many good things I can say about Mountain Home Ranch but the one that I really appreciated was the "at home" feeling shown by the hosts John and Suzzane. I was in Mountain Home Ranch the last week of January with a large group for a retreat and on the first night one in our group who had travelled from afar wanted a hot drink and we went to the dining room around 10pm. The dessert tray was left in there for late night snackers. Th dining room was cleaned and put to order but the dessert tray, plates and spoons were left out every night . This may seem a small but this is what I saw as being "at home". Hot water and lemonade or juice in the dining room throughout the day and night, John sharing stories and jokes in the dining room, heaters and extra blankets to make the cabins warm and cozy during the cold nights and being able to walk and hike around the ranch as if it was our own home. I am a vegetarian and I had delicious home cooked meals everyday. I was well cared for and I would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful, you care truly feel the care that the individuals put into the place.”
Reviews.Author: Lily_Kapiloff
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay so much. The stunning views, the quiet trails, the happy animals....I feelt that these people are making a conscious effort to live and work in a way that values all of an environment's inhabitants. This is so meaningful to me. The food was stupendous, healthy and accomedating to different dietary needs. And I am quite the picky eater, so I was very impressed. I highly reccomend this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful Rustic Joy!”
Reviews.Author: gen12
Reviews.Content: I just loved this place! Simple and rustic, very friendly staff, clean and cleansing of spirit. Remember to walk up to the lookout and enjoy the wind and view - I saw a bald eagle from there! I'm going back one day - maybe I'll see you ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, cozy place - can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Hiker_BJA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Mountain Home Ranch for one week, and I can't wait to go back. The place is set on beautiful grounds, with beautiful hiking trails nearby that go for miles. The food is delicious and the rooms are cozy. The rooms are not typical hotel-type rooms - mine had both a king and a double bed, but they had character. I recommend MHR highly for anyone looking for a quiet retreat, a bed and breakfast, or a place to go with a group.

Reviews.Title: “I CAN'T WAIT TO GET BACK THERE!!!"”
Reviews.Author: Kangs
Reviews.Content: I was assisting on a retreat that my group held at MHR and the few moments I had to walk away from the main ground were breathtaking views, beautiful trees and mountains. I can't wait to go for a weekend on my own so I can see more of it. I love the horses, cows and goats nearby and supply of carrots to help me interact with them. I found John and Suzanne friendly, helpful and easy to find if me or my group had questions or needs. Beds are comfy and cabins warm so I wasn't freezing as I do when camping. AND just an hour plus from the good old Bay where I live. So close what are you waiting for?!

Reviews.Title: “A supportive and nurturing environment for our retreat.”
Reviews.Author: banyanrose
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Mountain Home Ranch for a week long retreat. The location is private and rural yet very close to town. The beauty of the property, the cozy accommodations, ample meeting spaces, healthy food, the helpful and friendly staff and the presence of so many animals (horses, goats, chickens, cows and especially the gentle dogs) all helped to create a sanctuary for learning and relaxation for the week. It was January so I didn't use the pools, although they looked inviting for warmer weather.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed...”
Reviews.Author: IMPEI
Reviews.Content: Across two countries, and a continent, we found MHR and John and Suzanne didn't disappoint. Our cabin was spacious and had the best bed we've found in over 5 years of traveling! Each evening, Jessica, the dog, dropped by for an ear rub, and every morning before breakfast, Pebbles, the goat, tried to wean me from my smoking habit. We had the run of the place for the mid-week and between hiking and relaxing we couldn't have found a better place to totally relax. It was home, without the responsibility. Breakfast was tasty, with fruit, local farmed eggs and fresh baking. (The maple leaf shaped biscuits were a nice "detente" touch!) This place isn't for everyone. If you want to be continually catered to during your stay, it's not going to happen. But if you need a place to reconnect with what's really important in life, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: karenjoym
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one Saturday night after a day of wine tasting. The rooms were spotlessly clean and the homemade breakfast was delicious. Lots of cats and dogs around - it felt just like home. There is a very loud rooster that might wake you up at 5 am- he didn't bother me and I'm usually a light sleeper but my Dad was a bit annoyed. The rooms were warm and comfortable, nothing fancy. No TV which I like, but free wireless internet in the rooms. The only thing that would make this place perfect would be a hot tub or swimming pool open in the winter. I'll be going back when the weather is warmer.

Reviews.Title: “A place out of time... and worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: Writerbill60
Reviews.Content: Drive up Petrified Forest Road from Calistoga. You'll be heading over the mountain range that separates the Napa and Sonoma Valleys. Turn on Mountain Home Ranch Road. Follow the twists and turns, past small vineyards and big houses, through dark woods and across beautiful ridges, until you come to the old chuck wagon. There's a friendly place down the hill. Don't expect television or foam core mattresses or jacuzzis. The truth is my bed sagged, but the bathrooms are fine, and they have plenty of paperbacks, so you can read a book at night. And there's an excellent breakfast too. Most importantly, the place is run by warm, friendly people proud of their three generations on a beautiful spead of canyons, hiking trails, redwood groves, and a genuine sulphur warm spring. If you're looking for jumping bellhops and room service, go somewhere else, but if you want a different kind of relaxation, try it. We were glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant return”
Reviews.Author: keonichavez
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at MHR last year and wanted to renew our experience. The staff is consistently helpful and friendly, and they do a great job of being out of the way until needed. We love seeing Jessica the dog and partaking in the wonderful breakfasts every morning. If there was one thing that could have been improved, it was the wood-burning heater that warms the pool closest to the main house. The owner had apparently switched from propane to wood to save costs, which is commendable, but the smoke from the heater's chimney eventually gave us all headaches and made our clothes smell of smoke for hours after our visit. Perhaps a taller smokestack might alleviate this problem? Otherwise, another relaxing and enjoyable trip, and we hope to return either later this year or the next!

Reviews.Title: “A magic place”
Reviews.Author: soulwatch
Reviews.Content: Hardly a hotel - more like rustic cabins/camp environment. Attended an Artists Retreat there. One goes there to be outside, not inside. It is a sacred place - the hills and skies and forests are magic. The food is elemental and delicious. Accomodations basic but comfortable. You just have to open your heart up to the place and it will speak to you.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Inspiring”
Reviews.Author: travelmom089
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect when I booked a cottage for the fourth of July weekend with my husband and two kids. We were pleased to find a very charming and peaceful property. The facilities are rustic, but the cabins are exceptionally clean and cozy, and because the weather was so beautiful we spent most of our time either at one of the pools or hiking around the amazing property. It's a very open and friendly environment; great for kids and dogs. The breakfast was delicious and filling every morning too. It was the perfect place to come with a group of friends with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Inspiring”
Reviews.Author: guestx5
Reviews.Content: John and Suzanne are wonderful hosts. Their commitment to sustainability is truly inspiring for kids and adults alike.

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway for the family”
Reviews.Author: Datablade
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a "Meadowood" experience don't bother reading any further - MHR is not Meadowood. In fact, it is the anti-Meadowood. Which is one of the hundreds of reasons why I love this place. If you have kids - and your kids like to be outside - hiking, fishing, swimming, tennis, whatever... and you like a place that is low on pretense, but high on relaxation. MHR is the place. It is one of the most beautiful properties around. You can spend days here - and never want to leave. You can also use it as a convenient home base for trips into Napa and Sonoma. This place has been around for almost 100 years - it therefore has "character". For some people"character" means personality. For others MHR may have too much "character" - which I see from some Trip Advisor reviewers has been translated into "had rat in room". We just came back from MHR. We stayed in a cabin in the woods - and we were visited by a "rat" - a three-inch field mouse - every night. Frankly - we would have shocked if we hadn't been visited by one. You would have to be extremely naive about how the natural world works to stay in a rustic cabin in the woods and expect to not be visited by nature. Visit their website - the photos and descriptions accurately represent what you will find. MHR is not for everyone. MHR is not Meadowood. It is not Disneyland. BTW - the breakfasts are EXCELLENT. We have been coming here for 15 years - and it is always a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, friendly owners, beautiful surroundings, great dog!”
Reviews.Author: cookieholic
Reviews.Content: Beautiful area to hike. The owners were so friendly. Our last day we were the only group there so we were told to take the rest of the french toast to feed to the cows. I've never fed a cow, let alone french toast! They have a wonderful dog named Jessica (small pony size) who comes to visit. We bought a movie but couldn't watch it so they brought a T.V./DVD player to our room so we could watch it. Absolutely wonderful area to relax in and comfortable cabins.

Reviews.Title: “Rustic, peaceful, and historic - and much more”
Reviews.Author: thetravelerred
Reviews.Content: We deicded to go to Mt. Home Ranch because one of the travelers went there as a child -48 years ago and wanted to re-experience her joys of being there, she was nervous for us that it was too run down. Our experience was wonderful, yes very rustic and basic but the scenery amazing and the service the best! Would not hesitate going back.

Reviews.Title: “Mountain Home Ranch â€” A Great ReTreat Getaway”
Reviews.Author: CosmoRD
Reviews.Content: Mountain Home Ranch, like it's name, has a very comfortable, home-in-the-woods-away-from-home feel to it. It's comfortable, private, spacious and situated in beautiful country. We've held our four- and five-day company retreats there for nine years and look forward to going back again and again â€”including this year, 2010. The cabins are just right and the accommodations, though rustic, range from very comfortable to almost luxurious. The food is all lovingly prepared onsite and the meals often incorporate the natural produce (using no chemicals and only natural fertilizers), grown right at the ranch; it's delicious and nutritious. The kitchen staff are friendly, take great pride in their offerings and are genuinely interested in our culinary well-being. With advance notice, they make every effort to accommodate our various needsâ€”providing at each meal vegetarian/vegan options as well as addressing the special dietary needs of individuals in our group. Two of the many appreciations from our group's last stay: "The meals are super delicious, nutritious and very filling. The staff is phenomenal: generous, accommodating and warm." and "MHR and staff are wonderful. The food is prepared with love and beauty and while the accomodations are rustic, everything is clean and cozy. " I couldn't agree more. John and Suzanne, the owners and onsite hosts, are incredibly accommodating to our various needs. Ours is an unusual, sometimes boisterous, sometimes introspective, theater/fun-and-play-oriented company and Suzanne and John always help us feel comfortable, welcome and appreciated. And, I've noticed, at the same time, they are good at taking care of the other, generally quieter, guests who are there concurrent with our stay. Suzanne and John are there when needed, and out of sight when we wish to be left on our own. After previously holding our retreats for many years at another nearby retreat site, we are delighted to have moved to Mountain Home Ranch and plan to continue there for years to come. The Vice Emp says, "Check 'em out!"

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the outdoors and have delicious breakfasts too”
Reviews.Content: We came here to give our kids (6y, 3y, 1y) the chance to be outdoors and have a little more freedom to roam around. It is a beautiful place -- lots of oak and manzanita up above the cabins with a panaramic lookout, pines and firs around the cabins, and a creek down the hill. The kids also loved seeing and feeding the animals on the ranch, and my son who is normally afraid of dogs actually made friends with Jessica, who is very friendly and gentle. We stayed at the Madrones cabins, one of the larger cabins with a kitchen. The kids loved it for the loft above the living area. The accomodations are not luxury, but there are large public rooms in the great house. One of my kids has severe food allergies, and when we arrived I was afraid John was backtracking on accomodating his diet. However, John absolutely came through with flying colors, making French toast, potatoes, and pancakes with no eggs or dairy specially for my son. It was such a treat to have delicious home cooked food that my son can eat and that I didn't cook myself!

Reviews.Title: “rustic mountain paradise”
Reviews.Author: jenn45
Reviews.Content: We've been coming to the Mountain Home Ranch for 10 years and look forward each time to the proprietors' (John and Suzanne) warm hospitality, fantastic home-cooked breakfasts and the opportunity to unwind and relax at the pool and in the gorgeous surrounding mountains. If you're looking for a fancy up-scale resort--don't come! if you're looking for peace and quiet, a funky authentic old fashioned resort setting--this is a can't miss for you. It's affordable and offers easy access from the Bay Area (less than 2 hours with some traffic on 101). We wish we could make our visits monthly...and they're dog-friendly to boot!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: cerelacbaby
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most wonderful place, peaceful, rustic, beautiful views - 360 degrees of greenery....Very good get away from the concrete jungles. The owners are very wonderful people, very friendly & caring. I loved their breakfast. People who dont like rustic, you can choose to lodges to stay. They have a gr8 heated pool. I will definitely look forward to going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very peaceful and relaxing place with friendly atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: sanjose95117
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mountain Home Ranch for two days and were happy to see that all the good things we read in the reviews here were true and then some! The owners were very helpful and friendly. The cabins, while not "modern", were clean and had everything needed for a cozy stay, down to the small details like hardwood firewood, matches and special kindling to easily light the fire. Our breakfast surprised my mother who is a very picky eater. Her comment was that all the food was chosen for it's quality and not because of the price. Everything was fresh, tasty and healthy... yogurt, fresh cut fruits, etc. My whole family enjoyed our stay and we highly recommend it to those seeking a "closer to nature" type of vacation. PS I had forgotten my laptop charger, and called to see if they had seen it....John, the owner went to look for it while I was on the phone, found it, and asked me for an address to send it to! I received it the next day!!! Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “Rustic, relaxing time”
Reviews.Author: SadieKH
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have been at Mountain Home Ranch. This is a family business and they are proud of their tradition since 1913. There are over 300 acres with lots of trails, a near by lake (more like a pond). We came when there were no groups so we had lots of space. However, the pools were not available. The cabins with kitchens are adequate for cooking basic meals. Their breakfasts were wonderful with home made scones or muffins, eggs, and lots of fruit. We brought our dogs and they had a wonderful time. The owners are very friendly and helpful. We will keep coming to his wonderful place.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect getaway from city life.”
Reviews.Author: keonichavez
Reviews.Content: We had no issues with MHR beyond the almost nonexistent Wi-fi, but we'd been cautioned against that at the beginning. We're looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Mens group Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Faghja
Reviews.Content: We were searching for a group site that wouldn't break the bank! This was it. We found the owners to be exceptionally flexible and cooperative. We brought our own food, coffee and water and we got no argument from them. The rooms were clean, spacious, showers hot and the heaters worked. This Men's Group Retreat was a great success, because we didn't have to charge a high fee. The property is rustic, but close to Calistoga and the Sonoma County area. We will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home at Mountain Home Ranch.”
Reviews.Author: Ian_AndrewOakland_CA
Reviews.Content: I had many fond memories of times spent at Mountain Home Ranch as a child in the 1960's. Friends and family enjoying time together in a relaxed, informal and picturesque setting. As the years went by, my family stopped coming to the ranch. But I never forgot how much fun my sister and I had playing there as kids. I returned to Mountain Home Ranch with my wife and our one-year-old son in the spring of 2003. Since then we have become regular visitors. I now have two young boys who love to visit and feel very much at home there. Mountain Home Ranch is a wonderful place to unwind sorrounded by the beauty of nature. Bring some good walking shoes and you can enjoy the day exploring with a hike down along the creek or walk over to lake Orth. There is a pool near the lodge that is a refreshing splash ot of fun on those hot summer days. With a family atmosphere and a great breakfast in the morning this is an excellent place to make some happy memories with your family.

Reviews.Title: “Our Memory and It's History”
Reviews.Author: loveoutandabout
Reviews.Content: The place was very rustic. For us outdoor campers, we looked at it as an upgrade from camping. But when we checked-out the beddings, it was the beginning of disgust. The pillows smelled musky odor. Then I lifted the other pillows underneath, they had hairs. I didn't expect expect bells and whistles, but our beddings were NOT CLEAN. We drove downtown and bought Lysol to disinfect the room. We covered the pillows with our jackets. We used our picnic blankets as blankets. We then pulled the curtains shut and spiders fell down on the bed (didn't bother us much because were used to outdoor bugs). We decided not to have complimentary breakfast because if their sheets weren't clean, we couldn't imagine how the dishes and silverware are washed....

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here again. Worst experience ever. Don't do it.”
Reviews.Author: eedingdong
Reviews.Content: Its a shame because the land was beautiful. The staff was rude. When we got to our cabin there were children running around in it. Apparently they had stayed there the night before and had moved to a different cabin. The children came back in the middle of the night to look for clothing that they thought they had left inside. Apparently, they still had keys. We used the bbq area to cook out and were treated rudely by the staff who didn't like the mell of our food. No one said hello. no one said goodbye and then they charged my bank account 50 dollars more than agreed. We didn't take them up on the complimentary home cooked breakfast when we saw that the staff that had been rude to us the night before were serving the food.

Reviews.Title: “Mountain Home Ranch - Wonderful for a cozy Romantic Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: tvallis
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I decided to take a weekend off from our busy lives for a romance weekend away. We had heard many great things about Mountain Home Ranch, so we thought we'd give it a try. It was wonderful!! We stayed in one of their cottages, which included a kitchenette and a wood burning stove. It was a bit rustic, but it added to the charm of the place. The weekend was rainy, so we stayed in most of the time. Did I already say, It was amazing! There's no TV so we actually got to spend quality time together, as well as snuggling in front of a cozy fire. When we felt like getting out and about there was plenty to explore. The main lodge had the daily news paper, games, puzzles and other guest. We also bundled up and took our umbrellas for a walk in the canyon. Along the way we stopped to meet the many farm animals that make up their little petting zoo. Breakfast was great, the scones are my very favorite and I found the recipe on their website, www.mountainhomeranch.com . For all our other meals we were able to make in our unit. We even had a candle light dinner our last night there. We will definitely go back again! We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Needs serious update”
Reviews.Author: birdbrain45
Reviews.Content: To begin with they were disorganized in confirming my reservation (got the wrong dates). Nice greeting when we arrived but cabin not clean and no water. When water was turned on it was FULL of mud (not acceptable). Upper pool was dirty and trash bins FULL. We decided not to stay, asked for a refund and this was happily given. Nice people but not very professional. Cabins really need updating!

Reviews.Title: “Kid and dog friendly!”
Reviews.Author: DanTSanJose
Reviews.Content: Calistoga is not a particularly kid or pet friendly area so if you want to bring either, your options in this area are extremely limited. There was only one other accomodation that allowed pets and it had poor reviews so we tried this one. The Mountain Home Ranch primarily serves groups- probably church groups or other small organizations. But there were a few other families staying while we were there. The location is beautiful and isolated, but only a 10 minute drive to Calistoga. It is next to the Mayacamas Ranch, an obviously more upscale lodging option. We stayed at a cabin, the Oak. It was smallish and dated but reasonably clean and everything worked, including the heater and minifrig. The bed itself was soft, but about the same in comfort level as those in more expensive houses we have rented- I prefer firmer beds. The bathroom was small and the shower very narrow- we kept striking the knobs when turning and the water comes right down on top of you and high against the far side of the shower. There was no way to shower the kids in that thing. This place is great for dogs and kids. The owners have a dog that wanders all over the place and played for a while with our dog. We walked our dog off leash through the trails. There are farm animals including a cow and 2 horses that our kids fed carrots that were provided. If you hike down to the creek there are these small amphibians- maybe newts. The owners John and Suzanne were very helpful and attentive. The breakfasts were very good and satisfying- 2 hot dishes, scones, biscuits, variety of fruits, jam, bread, cereal, coffee, juice, etc. The dining room is also dated but comfortable. The whole property really could use some renovation- for example, there is a lookout area with a wooden platform where you can look across the valley but it is weathered and just barely safe. Overall, we had a great time here and I would definitely recommend it for those with kids or dogs, or if you just want some quiet and don't need 4 star accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed.....”
Reviews.Author: spanky_velo
Reviews.Content: Four of us cyclists found the Mountain Home Ranch above Calistoga to be a perfect place to stay for the evening after a long ride from San Francisco, John, the innkeeper, was extremely accomodating in meeting our calorie-depleted needs with a great pasta dinner (extra, but well worth it!), getting us ready for the return bike ride the next day. He also helped us out by allowing us to do a little laundry, taking care of some mail and greeting us with a "few" cold drinks upon our arrival. The rooms were spartan, but comfy for sleeping and reasonable; it's even cheaper for groups up to 8. If you want shee-shee, go spend your $$$ elsewhere. The dining room was comfortable to hang out in before dinner and breakfast the next morning was tasty and plentiful, even for piggy cyclists. We hope to be back, but next time less tired, so we can enjoy the local hiking and pools! Thanks again, John.

Reviews.Title: “wine country accomodations with a folksey feel”
Reviews.Author: minnesotasparky
Reviews.Content: Our accommodations fit what we were looking for. Affordable adjoined rooms in the heart of Wine Country with access to hiking trails and beautiful scenery. The rooms are sparsely decorated and the beds are similar to what one would expect at summer camp a little saggy and lumpy. The toilet handle needed an occasional jiggle and one didn't want to look too hard for cobwebs and the like. Although the facility probably would pass regulatory standards, maintenance in general was below average. What the property lacks in creature comforts, it makes up for in access to nature, a small collection of farm animals, beautiful mountain top views and trails down to a creek bed among old growth redwoods. In the evenings, we drove a short way to Calistoga for our evening meals.The breakfast was adequate served in a dining room reminiscent of camp. We had many opportunities for laughter and bliss! This is a very friendly Mom & Pop place oozing in down home ambiance without pretense. The pace is informal and encourages one to appreciate natural beauty presented in a setting reminiscent of a bygone era.

Reviews.Title: “great rustic get-away”
Reviews.Author: cruzerdad
Reviews.Content: Old school charm at affordable prices. Close to downtown Calistoga but a whole different world away. I loved the canyons and the lake and being able to have my dog with me was a big plus. The pools were refreshing and the staff was wonderful. The scones for breakfast were the best! Not fancy but just what I was looking for. The other review was not of the normal accommodations but of one of the rustic cabins. The lodge rooms and the winterized cabins are quite nice and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nature lover's paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rustic! Loved hiking well marked trails, very hilly, deep woods with sun drenched meadows. Deep canyons with glorious volcanic bed streams. Large redwoods in canyons, even a petrified redwood in the streambed. Natural sulfer spring tub in the woods. Enjoyed the warm swimming pool in the a.m. and late evening to loosen up tired muscles. The larger pool is cool and refreshing after a long hike and the lake is a delight! The hosts are a delightful couple. This ranch has been in the family since early 1900's. If you are lucky enough to be there when a group is there, you can get 3 meals a day, otherwise, breakfast only. Some cabins have kitchenettes. Cook is creative and talented. Lots of other activities available on site and nearby. This is heaven for the real nature lover. Their pets include horses, a jersey cow, goats, chickens, ducks. A resident wild raven rides on the back of one of the horses. Wildflowers were amazing in late June. Definitely going back!
